comment: If you love rock, take this class! The reading is interesting - 14 weekly quizzes and discussions, three listening journals (2 albums each), a modern artist project, and two listening exams make up the grades. He grades quickly and pretty leniently. The listening exams were hard - I flunked both of them - but I made up for it with the extra credit.

This is a great class and professor Wright is excellent. There were weekly quizzes based on the presentations, a few discussions and short papers, and a final project and exam. It sounds like a lot, but it really isnt that bad all assignments are quite straightfoward. Prof Wright will also respond to emails very quickly! Didnt need the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mr. Wright is a great professor and a solid choice for an online class. He is very knowledgable about the material and even makes weekly videos with him playing an instrument to help demonstrate the material. Class is heavy on papers, so be prepared to write 3 journals which are minimum 4 pages each.

This class was pretty enjoyable even though I'm not into rock music. The workload could be a little heavy on some weeks, but most of the time it was okay. There were very few extra credit opportunities! We had 3 papers, 2 tests & a project along with weekly assignments. Just don't procrastinate & you should pass. He also answers emails!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you go to class and do the work you will do well. There's a group project. Listening homework is on Spotify and this is required! Several papers are assigned at a 3pg max on an album MLA. Tests are on material covered in class. He is very clear about grading. He is very approachable if you have questions. Lots of extra credit opportunities!

You can miss 5 days before it affects your grade, but it is very easy for another person to sign you in. Very easy professor, you don't really need the book. His tests come straight from his study guides. Very easy A as long as you study the night before the test

Very nice man, he really knows what he's talking about and he wants to help you succeed! The lectures are boring but at least it is easy to catch up if you miss a day. You are allowed to miss 5 days. He made the topics very interesting but he would talk too much sometimes, especially right before he was gonna show us a song! But I'd take him still!

I liked this course. Professor Wright is not a hard professor at all. He gives you study guides before every test so you can study. Overall, liked the class even though his lectures can get rather boring.

He taught mostly using powerpoints; it was also important to read the chapters in the textbook. He is a funny guy and very relatable. Professor Wright is also a talented jazz guitarist: I heard him play and I really enjoyed it. Tests weren't too bad and he usually prepared us well. I definitely reccomend his class.

Good teacher, easy material. He's a little geeky (not a bad thing) and very passionate about his teaching. Study guide to every test with bonus points, and he puts his powerpoints online. There are concert requirements, not a huge deal. Only downside is mandatory attendance.

Easy class, but a lot of material. He gives a study guide for every test. 3 tests, 2 events to attend(1 on campus & 1 off-campus), 1 group project. Good teacher, but hate that class is mandatory. I learned a lot from this class & it was very interesting. Take him!

He's a good teacher, I really enjoyed his class. The study guides are FANTASTIC - use those in conjunction with his PowerPoints and you'll do great on the tests. The material was really interesting and relevant. He provides multiple opportunities for bonus points on the tests and the music event attendance requirements.
Very knowledgeable, take the history of rock class if possible.  Gives study guides, know the material on them, and you should get an "A" on the tests.
I really enjoyed taking this class. 1107 is a music history class, but you learn a few things about music theory, too! Wright is a great music professor and a very nice guy. I'd recommend!

I learned a lot in the History of Rock and Roll course! He knows his stuff. The book is pretty much useless, so just look over the powerpoints and use the internet to study. Do everything you can to get other points besides testing. There aren't too many grades, so you want to do everything well. You must work for your grade. It's a good class.
He's very intelligent and give you this craving to learn & respect music. I'm going to miss this class when it's over. Use the study guides they help a ton!
Awesome teacher. Helpful and understanding. You have to work hard though.

Trey is a seriously awesome teacher and musician, and he knows his stuff backwards and forwards. Very helpful and professional. He is really strict though, and won't let you get by with any crap. Beware if you want an easy A.
